_comment: Copyright: Copyright (C) 2012-2016 Netronome Systems, Inc.  All rights reserved.

fields.description: Next Capability Offset: Indicates offset to the next PCI Express capability structure. The default next pointer value is dynamic and is dependent on whether the strap or LMI bits are set.
fields.name: NCO

fields.description: Capability Version:  Specifies the SIG assigned value for the version of the capability structure. This field reflects the setting of the corresponding field in the AER Enhanced Capability Header Register of PF 0.
fields.name: CV

fields.description: PCI Express Extended Capability ID: This field is hardwired to the Capability ID assigned by PCI SIG to the PCI Express AER Extended Capability Structure (0001 hex).
fields.name: PECID

fields.description: Reserved: Reserved
fields.name: R13

fields.description: Next Capability Offset: Indicates offset to the next PCI Express capability structure. The default next pointer value is dynamic and is dependent on whether the strap or LMI bits are set.
fields.name: NCO

fields.description: Capability Version: Specifies the SIG-assigned value for the version of the capability structure. This field is taken from the setting of the corresponding field in the ARI Extended Capability Header Register of PF 0.
fields.name: CV

fields.description: PCI Express Extended Capability ID: This field is hardwired to the Capability ID assigned by PCI-SIG to the ARI Extended Capability (000E hex).
fields.name: PCCID

fields.description: Reserved: Reserved
fields.name: R2

fields.description: ST Table Size: Specifies the number of entries in the Steering Tag Table (0 = 1 entry, 1 = 2 entries, and so on). Max limit is 64 entries when the ST Table is located in the TPH Requester Capability Structure, and 2048 entries when located in the MSI-X table. Each entry is 16 bits long. This field can be modified from the local management bus.
fields.name: STTS

fields.description: Reserved: Reserved
fields.name: R1

fields.description: ST Table Location: The setting of this field indicates if a Steering Tag Table is implemented for this Function, and its location if present. (00 = ST Table not present, 01 = ST Table in the TPH Requester Capability Structure, 10 = ST values stored in the MSI-X Table in client RAM, 11 = reserved.). This field can be modified from the local management bus.
fields.name: STTL

fields.description: Extended TPH Requester Supported: When set to 1, indicates that the Function is capable of generating requests with a TPH TLP Prefix.
fields.name: ERS

fields.description: Reserved: Reserved
fields.name: R0

fields.description: Device-Specific Mode Supported:  A setting of 1 indicates that the Function supports the Device- Specific Mode for TPH Steering Tag generation. In this mode, the Steering Tags are supplied by the client for each request through the HAL master interface. The client typically chooses the Steering Tag values from the ST Table, but is not required to do so. This bit is set to 1 by default, but can be modified from the local management bus.
fields.name: DSMS

fields.description: Interrupt Vector Mode Supported: A setting of 1 indicates that the Function supports the Interrupt Vector Mode for TPH Steering Tag generation. In the Interrupt Vector Mode, Steering Tags are attached to MSI/MSI-X interrupt requests. The Steering Tag for each interrupt request is selected by the MSI/MSI-X interrupt vector number. This bit is set to 1 by default, but can be modified from the local management bus.
fields.name: IVMS

fields.description: No ST Mode Supported: When set to 1, indicates that this Function supports the 'No ST Mode' for the generation of TPH Steering Tags. In the No ST Mode, the device must use a Steering Tag value of 0 for all requests. This bit is hardwired to 1, as all TPH Requesters are required to support the No ST Mode of operation.
fields.name: NSTM

fields.description: Reserved: Reserved
fields.name: R10

fields.description: TPH Requester Enable: When set , the Function is allowed to generate requests with Transaction Processing Hints. Defined Encodings are: 00b Function operating as a Requester is not permitted to issue Requests with TPH or Extended TPH. 01b Function operating as a Requester is permitted to issue Requests with TPH and is not permitted to issue Requests with Extended TPH. 10b Reserved. 11b Function operating as a Requester is permitted to issue Requests with TPH and Extended TPH.
fields.name: TRE

fields.description: ST Mode: This field selects the ST mode (000 = No Steering Tag Mode, 001 = Interrupt Vector Mode, 010 = Device-Specific Mode, other values are reserved). The VF_TPH_ST_MODE output of the core reflects the setting of this register field (bits 3:0 for VF 0 and so on).  This field can also be written from the local management bus.
fields.name: STM

fields.description: Next Capability Offset: Indicates offset to the next PCI Express capability structure. The default next pointer value is dynamic and is dependent on whether the strap or LMI bits are set.
fields.name: NCO

fields.description: Capability Version: Specifies the SIG assigned value for the version of the capability structure. This field is set by default to 1, but can be modified for all VFs by writing into this register field of Physical Function 0 from the local management bus.
fields.name: CV

fields.description: PCI Express Extended Capability ID: This field is hardwired to the Capability ID assigned by PCI SIG to the TPH Requester Capability.
fields.name: PECID

fields.description: ST 1 Upper: This field is used for the upper 8 bits of the second Steering Tag when Extended TPH Requester support is enabled.
fields.name: ST1U

fields.description: ST 1 Lower: Lower 8 bits of the second Steering Tag. This is the 8-bit Steering Tag sent out in requests.
fields.name: ST1L

fields.description: ST 0 Upper: This field is used for the upper 8 bits of the first Steering Tag when Extended TPH Requester support is enabled.
fields.name: ST0U

fields.description: ST 0 Lower: Lower 8 bits of the first Steering Tag. This is the 8-bit Steering Tag sent out in requests.
fields.name: ST0L

fields.description: Reserved: Reserved
fields.name: RSVD

fields.description: Reserved: Reserved
fields.name: R18

fields.description: Multiple Header Recording Enable: Setting this bit enables the Function to log multiple error headers in its Header Log Registers. It is hardwired to 0
fields.name: MHRE

fields.description: Multiple Header Recording Capable: This bit is set when the Function has the capability to log more than one error header in its Header Log Registers. It is hardwired to 0.
fields.name: MHRC

fields.description: Enable ECRC Check: Setting this bit enables ECRC checking on the receive side of the core. This bit is hardwired to 0. The setting of the corresponding bit in the Advanced Error Capabilities and Control Register of PF 0 applies to all Virtual Functions.
fields.name: ECC

fields.description: ECRC Check Capability: This read-only bit indicates to the software that the device is capable of checking ECRC in packets received from the link. This bit is hardwired to 0. This setting of the corresponding bit in the Advanced Error Capabilities and Control Register of PF 0 applies to all Virtual Functions.
fields.name: ECCAP

fields.description: Enable ECRC Generation: Enables the ECRC generation on the transmit side of the core. This bit is hardwired to 0. The setting of the corresponding bit in the Advanced Error Capabilities and Control Register of PF 0 applies to all Virtual Functions.
fields.name: EEG

fields.description: ECRC Generation Capability: This read-only bit indicates to the software that the device is capable of generating ECRC in packets transmitted on the link. This bit is hardwired to 0. The setting of the corresponding bit in the Advanced Error Capabilities and Control Register of PF 0 applies to all Virtual Functions.
fields.name: EGC

fields.description: First Error Pointer: This is a 5-bit pointer to the bit position in the Uncorrectable Error Status Register corresponding to the error that was detected first. When there are multiple bits set in the Uncorrectable Error Status Register, this field informs the software which error was observed first. To prevent the field from being overwritten before software was able to read it, this field is not updated while the status bit pointed by it in the Uncorrectable Error Status Register remains set. After the software clears this status bit, a subsequent error condition that sets any bit in the Uncorrectable Error Status Register will update the First Error Pointer. Any uncorrectable error type, including the special cases where the error is reported using an ERR_COR message, will set the First Error Pointer (assuming the software has reset the error pointed by it in the Uncorrectable Error Status Register). STICKY.
fields.name: FER

fields.description: Not Implemented:
fields.name: NI

fields.description: Not Implemented:
fields.name: NI

fields.description: Not Implemented:
fields.name: NI

fields.description: Not Implemented:
fields.name: NI

fields.description: Not Implemented:
fields.name: NI

fields.description: Not Implemented:
fields.name: NI

fields.description: BIST Register: Reserved
fields.name: BR

fields.description: Device Type: Identifies whether the device supports a single Function or multiple Functions. This bit is read as 0 when only Function 0 has been enabled in the Physical Function Configuration Register (in the local management block). Reserved for VFs
fields.name: DT

fields.description: Header Type: Reserved
fields.name: HT

fields.description: Latency Timer: Reserved
fields.name: LT

fields.description: Cache Line Size: Reserved
fields.name: CLS

fields.description: Reserved: Reserved
fields.name: R6

fields.description: Capabilities Pointer: Contains pointer to the first PCI Capability Structure. This field is set by default to point to the Power Management Capability Structure. It can be modified by writing to VF 0 from the local management bus, and the setting is common across all VFs.
fields.name: CP

fields.description: Detected Parity Error: This bit is set when the core has received a Poisoned TLP targeted at this VF. The Parity Error Response enable bit (bit 6) in the PCI Command Register of the associated PF has no  effect on the setting of this bit. STICKY.
fields.name: DPE

fields.description: Signaled System Error: If the SERR enable bit in the PCI Command Register of the associated Physical Function is 1,  this bit is set when this VF has sent out a fatal or non-fatal error message on the link to the Root  Complex. If the SERR enable bit is 0, this bit remains 0. This field can also be cleared from the  local management bus by writing a 1 into this bit position. STICKY.
fields.name: SSE

fields.description: Received Master Abort: This bit is set when this VF has received a completion from the link with the Unsupported  Request status. This field can also be cleared from the local management bus by writing a 1 into  this bit position. STICKY.
fields.name: RMA

fields.description: Received Target Abort: This bit is set when this Virtual Function has received a completion from the link with the  Completer Abort status. This field can also be cleared from the local management bus by writing a 1  into this bit position. STICKY.
fields.name: RTA

fields.description: Signaled Target Abort: This bit is set when the core has sent a completion from this VF to the link with the  Completer Abort status. This field can also be cleared from the local management bus by writing a 1 into this bit position. STICKY.
fields.name: STA

fields.description: Reserved: Reserved
fields.name: R5

fields.description: Master Data Parity Error: When the Parity Error Response enable bit in the PCI Command Register of the associated Physical Function is set, the core sets this bit when it detects the following error conditions: (i) The core receives a Poisoned Completion TLP from the link in response to a request from this VF. (ii) The core sends out a poisoned write request on the link from this VF. (This bit remains 0 when the Parity Error Response enable bit in the PCI Command Register of the associated Physical Function is 0). This field can also be cleared from the local management bus by writing a 1 into this bit position. STICKY.
fields.name: MDPE

fields.description: Reserved: Reserved
fields.name: R4

fields.description: Capabilities List: Indicates the presence of PCI Extended Capabilities registers. This bit is hardwired to 1.
fields.name: CL

fields.description: Interrupt Status: Reserved
fields.name: IS

fields.description: Reserved: Reserved
fields.name: R3

fields.description: INTx Message Disable: Reserved
fields.name: IMD

fields.description: Reserved: Reserved
fields.name: R2

fields.description: SERR Enable: Reserved
fields.name: SE

fields.description: Reserved: Reserved
fields.name: R1

fields.description: Parity Error Response Enable: Reserved
fields.name: PERE

fields.description: Reserved: Reserved
fields.name: R0

fields.description: Bus-Master Enable: Enables the device to issue memory requests from this Function. This field can be written from the local management bus.
fields.name: BME

fields.description: Mem-Space Enable: Reserved
fields.name: MSE

fields.description: IO-Space Enable: Reserved
fields.name: IOSE

fields.description: Reserved:
fields.name: R17

fields.description: Header Log Overflow Mask: This bit, when set, masks the generation of error messages in response to a Header Log register overflow. STICKY. Header logs are shared across Vfs hence this field is reserved. This field is reserved since Header log sharing is selected for this configuration.
fields.name: HLOM

fields.description: Corrected Internal Error Mask: This bit is not implemented for Virtual Functions. Hardwired to 0.
fields.name: CIEM

fields.description: Advisory Non-Fatal Error Mask: This bit is not implemented for Virtual Functions. Hardwired to 0.
fields.name: ANFEM

fields.description: Replay Timer Timeout Mask: This bit is not implemented for Virtual Functions. Hardwired to 0.
fields.name: RTTM

fields.description: Reserved: Reserved
fields.name: R16

fields.description: Replay Number Rollover Mask: This bit is not implemented for Virtual Functions. Hardwired to 0.
fields.name: RNRM

fields.description: Bad DLLP Mask: This bit is not implemented for Virtual Functions. Hardwired to 0.
fields.name: BDM

fields.description: Bad TLP Mask: This bit is not implemented for Virtual Functions. Hardwired to 0.
fields.name: BTM

fields.description: Reserved: Reserved
fields.name: R15

fields.description: Receiver Error Mask: This bit is not implemented for Virtual Functions. Hardwired to 0.
fields.name: REM

fields.description: Reserved: Reserved
fields.name: R14

fields.description: Header Log Overflow Status: This bit is set on a Header Log Register overflow, that is, when the header could not be logged in the Header Log Register because it is occupied by a previous header. STICKY.
fields.name: HLOS

fields.description: Corrected Internal Error Status: This bit is not implemented for Virtual Functions. Hardwired to 0.
fields.name: CIES

fields.description: Advisory Non-Fatal Error Status: This bit is set when an uncorrectable error occurs, which is determined to belong to one of the special cases described in Section 6.2.3.2.4 of the PCI Express 2.0 Specifications. This causes the core to generate an ERR_COR message in place of an ERR_NONFATAL message. STICKY.
fields.name: ANFES

fields.description: Replay Timer Timeout Status: This bit is not implemented for Virtual Functions. Hardwired to 0.
fields.name: RTTS

fields.description: Reserved: Reserved
fields.name: R13

fields.description: Replay Number Rollover Status: This bit is not implemented for Virtual Functions. Hardwired to 0.
fields.name: RNRS

fields.description: Bad DLLP Status: This bit is not implemented for Virtual Functions. Hardwired to 0.
fields.name: BDS

fields.description: Bad TP Status: This bit is not implemented for Virtual Functions. Hardwired to 0.
fields.name: BTPS

fields.description: Reserved: Reserved
fields.name: R12

fields.description: Receiver Error Status: This bit is not implemented for Virtual Functions. Hardwired to 0.
fields.name: RES

fields.description: Not Implemented:
fields.name: NI

fields.description: Header DWORD 0: First DWORD of captured TLP header STICKY.
fields.name: HD0

fields.description: Header DWORD 1: Second DWORD of captured TLP header STICKY.
fields.name: HD1

fields.description: Header DWORD 2: Third DWORD of captured TLP header STICKY.
fields.name: HD2

fields.description: Header DWORD 3: Fourth DWORD of captured TLP header STICKY.
fields.name: HD3

fields.description: Not Implemented:
fields.name: NI

fields.description: Port Number: Specifies the port number assigned to the PCI Express link connected to this device.
fields.name: PN

fields.description: Reserved: Reserved
fields.name: R5

fields.description: ASPM Optionality Compliance: Setting this bit indicates that the device supports the ASPM Optionality feature. It can be turned off by writing a 0 to this bit position through the local management bus.
fields.name: AOC

fields.description: Link Bandwidth Notification Capability: A value of 1b indicates support for the Link Bandwidth Notification status and interrupt mechanisms. Reserved for Endpoint.
fields.name: LBNC

fields.description: Data Link Layer Active Reporting Capability: Set to 1 if the device is capable of reporting that the DL Control and Management State Machine has reached the DL_Active state. This bit is hardwired to 0, as this version of the core does not support the feature.
fields.name: DLLARC

fields.description: Surprise Down Error Reporting Capability: Indicates the capability of the device to report a Surprise Down error condition. This bit is hardwired to 0, as this version of the core does not support the feature.
fields.name: SDERC

fields.description: Clock Power Management: Indicates that the device supports removal of referenc clocks. It is set by default to the value of the define in reg_defaults.h. It can be re-written independently for each function from the local management bus.
fields.name: CPM

fields.description: L1 Exit Latency: Specifies the exit latency from L1 state. This parameter is dependent on the Physical Layer implementation. It is set by default to the value define in reg_defaults.h. It can be re-written independently for each Function from the local management bus.
fields.name: L1EL

fields.description: L0S Exit Latency: Specifies the time required for the device to transition from L0S to L0. This parameter is dependent on the Physical Layer implementation. It is set by default to the value define in reg_defaults.h. It can be re-written independently for each Function from the local management bus.
fields.name: L0SEL

fields.description: Active State Power Management: Indicates the level of ASPM support provided by the device. This field can be re-written independently for each Function from the local management bus. When SRIS is enabled in local management register bit, L0s capability is not supported and is forced low.
fields.name: ASPM

fields.description: Maximum Link Width: Indicates the maximum number of lanes supported by the device. This field is hardwired based on the setting of the LANE_COUNT_IN strap input.
fields.name: MLW

fields.description: Maximum Link Speed: Indicates the maximum speed supported by the link. (2.5 GT/s, 5 GT/s, 8 GT/s per lane). This field is hardwired to 0001 (2.5GT/s) when the strap input PCIE_GENERATION_SEL is set to 0, to 0010 (5 GT/s) when the strap is set to 1, and to 0011 (8 GT/s) when the strap input is set to 10.
fields.name: MLS

fields.description: Reserved: Reserved
fields.name: R0

fields.description: MSI masking capable: can be modified using localmanagement interface
fields.name: MC

fields.description: 64-Bit Address Capable: Set to 1 to indicate that the device is capable of generating 64-bit addresses for MSI messages.
fields.name: AC64

fields.description: Multiple Message Enable: Encodes the number of distinct messages that the core is programmed to generate for this Function (000 = 1, 001 = 2, 010 = 4, 011 = 8, 100 = 16, 101 = 32). This setting must be based on the number of interrupt inputs of the core that are actually used by this Function. This field can be written from the local management bus.
fields.name: MME

fields.description: Multiple Message Capable: Encodes the number of distinct messages that the core is capable of generating for this Function (000 = 1, 001 = 2, 010 = 4, 011 = 8, 100 = 16, 101 = 32). Thus, this field defines the number of the interrupt vectors for this Function. The core allows up to 32 distinct messages, but the setting of this field must be based on the number of interrupt inputs of the core that are actually used by the client. For example, if the client logic uses 8 of the 32 distinct MSI interrupt inputs of the core for this Function, then the value of this field must be set to 011. This field can be written from the local management bus. Please see the `define den_db_VF_MSI_MULTIPLE_MSG_CAPABLE for default value in the reg_defaults.v files.
fields.name: MMC

fields.description: MSI Enable: Set by the configuration program to enable the MSI feature. This field can also be written from the local management bus.
fields.name: ME

fields.description: Capabilities Pointer: Pointer to the next PCI Capability Structure. The value read from this read-only field is the corresponding pointer in the MSI Capability Structure of the Physical Function this VF is attached to.  The setting is common across all the Virtual Functions.
fields.name: CP

fields.description: Capability ID: Specifies that the capability structure is for MSI. Hardwired to 05 hex.
fields.name: CID

fields.description: Reserved: Please note that if the Multiple Message Capable field is changed from the local management bus, then  the width of this field also changes correspondingly
fields.name: R0

fields.description: MSI Mask: Mask bits for MSI interrupts.  The Multiple Message Capable field of the MSI Control Register specifies the number of  distinct interrupts for the Function, which determines the number of valid mask bits. Please note that if the Multiple Message Capable field is changed from the local management bus, then  the width of the MSI Mask field also changes correspondingly
fields.name: MM

fields.description: Reserved: Hardwired to 0
fields.name: R2

fields.description: Message Data: Message data to be used for this Function. This field can also be written from the local management bus.
fields.name: MD

fields.description: Message Address High: Contains bits 63:32 of the 64-bit address to be used in MSI Messages. A value of 0 specifies that 32-bit addresses are to be used in the messages. This field can also be written from the local management bus.
fields.name: MAH

fields.description: Message Address Low: Lower bits of the address to be used in MSI messages. This field can also be written from the local management bus.
fields.name: MAL

fields.description: Reserved: The two lower bits of the address are hardwired to 0 to align the address on a double-word boundary.
fields.name: R1

fields.description: Reserved: Please note that if the Multiple Message Capable field is changed from the local management bus, then  the width of this field also changes correspondingly
fields.name: R0

fields.description: MSI Pending Bits: Pending bits for MSI interrupts. This register contains the MSI pending interrupt bits, one for each of the interrupt  levels. This field can be written from the local management bus. The Multiple Message Capable field of the MSI Control Register specifies the number of  distinct interrupts for the Function, which determines the number of valid pending bits. Please note that if the Multiple Message Capable field is changed from the local management bus, then  the width of the MSI Pending Bits field also changes correspondingly
fields.name: MP

fields.description: MSI-X Enable: Set by the configuration program to enable the MSI-X feature. This field can also be written from the local management bus.
fields.name: MSIXE

fields.description: Function Mask: This bit serves as a global mask to all the interrupt conditions associated with this Function. When this bit is set, the core will not send out MSI messages from this Function. This field can also be written from the local management bus.
fields.name: FM

fields.description: Reserved: Reserved
fields.name: R0

fields.description: MSI-X Table Size: Specifies the size of the MSI-X Table, that is, the number of interrupt vectors defined for the Function. The programmed value is 1 minus the size of the table (that is, this field is set to 0 if the table size is 1.). It can be re-written independently for each Function from the local management bus.
fields.name: MSIXTS

fields.description: Capabilities Pointer: Contains a pointer to the next PCI Capability Structure. The value read from this  read-only field is the corresponding pointer in the MSI-X Capability Structure of the Physical Function this VF is attached to.
fields.name: CP

fields.description: Capability ID: Identifies that the capability structure is for MSI-X. This field is set by default to 11 hex. It can be rewritten independently for each Function from the local management bus.
fields.name: CID

fields.description: PBA Offset: Offset of the memory address where the PBA is located, relative to the selected BAR. The three least significant bits of the address are omitted, as the addresses are QWORD aligned.
fields.name: PO

fields.description: BAR Indicator Register: Identifies the BAR corresponding to the memory address range where the PBA Structure is located (000 = BAR 0, 001 = BAR 1, ... , 101 = BAR 5). The value programmed must be the same as the BAR Indicator configured in the MSI-X Table Offset Register.Identifies the BAR corresponding to the memory address range where the PBA Structure is located (000 = BAR 0, 001 = BAR 1, ... , 101 = BAR 5). The value programmed must be the same as the BAR Indicator configured in the MSI-X Table Offset Register.
fields.name: BARI

fields.description: Table Offset: Offset of the memory address where the MSI-X Table is located, relative to the selected BAR. The three least significant bits of the address are omitted, as the addresses are QWORD aligned.
fields.name: TO

fields.description: BAR Indicator Register: Identifies the BAR corresponding to the memory address range where the MSI-X Table is located (000 = BAR 0, 001 = BAR 1, ... , 101 = BAR 5).
fields.name: BARI

fields.description: Reserved: Reserved
fields.name: R0

fields.description: TCS Routing Supported: When set to 1, this bit indicates that the device supports routing of Trusted Configuration Requests. Not valid for Endpoints. Hardwired to 0.
fields.name: TRS

fields.description: Interrupt Message Number: Identifies the MSI or MSI-X interrupt vector for the interrupt message generated corresponding to the status bits in the Slot Status Register, Root Status Register, or this capability structure. This field must be defined based on the chosen interrupt mode - MSI or MSI-X. This field is hardwired to 0.
fields.name: IMN

fields.description: Slot Status: Set to 1 when the link connected to a slot. Hardwired to 0.
fields.name: SS

fields.description: Device Type: Indicates the type of device implementing this Function. This field is hardwired to 0 in the EP mode.
fields.name: DT

fields.description: Capability Version: Identifies the version number of the capability structure.  The value depends on the value of the strap input PCIE_GENERATION_SEL If PCIE_GENERATION_SEL indicates Gen 2 or later generations, then the value is 2 else 1.
fields.name: CV

fields.description: Next Capability Pointer: Points to the next PCI capability structure. Set to 0 because this is the last capability structure.
fields.name: NCP

fields.description: Capability ID: Specifies Capability ID assigned by PCI SIG for this structure. This field is hardwired to 10 hex.
fields.name: CID

fields.description: Reserved: Reserved
fields.name: R14

fields.description: Max End-End TLP Prefixes: Indicates the maximum number of End-End TLP Prefixes supported by the Function. The supported  values are: 01b 1 End-End TLP Prefix 10b 2 End-End TLP Prefixes
fields.name: MEEP

fields.description: End-End TLP Prefix Supported: Indicates whether the Function supports End-End TLP Prefixes. A 1 in this field indicates that  the Function supports receiving TLPs containing End-End TLP Prefixes.
fields.name: EEPS

fields.description: Extended Format Field Supported: Indicates that the Function supports the 3-bit definition of the Fmt field in the TLP header.  This bit is hardwired to 1 for all Physical Functions.
fields.name: EXFS

fields.description: OBFF Supported: A 1 in this bit position indicates that the Function supports the Optimized Buffer Flush/Fill (OBFF) capability using message signaling.
fields.name: OPFFS

fields.description: Reserved: Reserved
fields.name: R13

fields.description: TPH Completer Supported: These bits, when set, indicate that the Function is capable of serving as a completer for requests with Transaction Processing Hints (TPH). It can be turned off for all Physical Functions by writing into PF 0. Defined Encodings are: 00b TPH and Extended TPH Completer not supported. 01b TPH Completer supported Extended TPH Completer not supported. 10b Reserved. 11b Both TPH and Extended TPH Completer supported.
fields.name: TCS

fields.description: LTR Mechanism Supported: A 1 in this bit position indicates that the Function supports the Latency Tolerance Reporting (LTR) Capability. This bit is set to 1 by default, but can be turned off for all Physical Functions by writing into PF 0.
fields.name: LMS

fields.description: Reserved: Reserved
fields.name: R12

fields.description: 128-Bit CAS Atomic Op Completer Supported: A 1 in this bit position indicates that the Function supports completer capability for the Compare-and- Swap (CAS) Atomic Operation with 128-bit operands. This bit is set to 1 by default, but can be overwritten independently for each Function from the local management bus.
fields.name: BAOCS128

fields.description: 64-Bit Atomic Op Completer Supported: A 1 in this bit position indicates that the Function supports completer capability for 64-bit Atomic Operations. This bit is set to 1 by default, but can be overwritten independently for each Function from the local management bus.
fields.name: BAOCS64

fields.description: 32-Bit Atomic Op Completer Supported: A 1 in this bit position indicates that the Function supports completer capability for 32-bit Atomic Operations. This bit is set to 1 by default, but can be overwritten independently for each Function from the local management bus.
fields.name: BAOCS32

fields.description: OP routing supported: Atomic OP routing supported.
fields.name: OPRS

fields.description: ARI forwarding support: ARI forwarding supported.
fields.name: AFS

fields.description: Completion Timeout Disable Supported: A 1 in this field indicates that the associated Function supports the capability to turn off its Completion timeout. This bit is set to 1 by default, but can be re-written independently for each Function from the local management bus.
fields.name: CTDS

fields.description: Completion Timeout Ranges: Specifies the Completion Timeout values supported by the device. This field is set by default to 0010 (10 ms - 250 ms). The actual timeout values are in two programmable local management registers, which allow the timeout settings of the two sub-ranges within Range B to be programmed independently.
fields.name: CTR

fields.description: Reserved: Reserved
fields.name: R3

fields.description: FLR Capable: Set when device has Function-Level Reset capability. Hardwired to 1.
fields.name: FLRC

fields.description: Captured Power Limit Scale:  This field reflects the setting of the corresponding field in the PCIe Device Capability Register of PF 0.
fields.name: CPLS

fields.description: Captured Slot Power Limit Value: This field reflects the setting of the corresponding field in the PCIe Device Capability Register of PF 0.
fields.name: CSPLV

fields.description: Reserved: Reserved
fields.name: R2

fields.description: Role-Based Error Reporting: This field reflects the setting of the corresponding field in the PCIe Device Capability Register of PF 0.
fields.name: RBER

fields.description: Reserved: Reserved
fields.name: R1

fields.description: Acceptable L1 Latency: Specifies acceptable latency that the Endpoint can tolerate while transitioning from L1 to L0. This field reflects the setting of the corresponding field in the PCIe Device Capability Register of PF 0.
fields.name: AL1SL

fields.description: Acceptable L0S Latency: Specifies acceptable latency that the Endpoint can tolerate while transitioning from L0S to L0. This field reflects the setting of the corresponding field in the PCIe Device Capability Register of PF 0.
fields.name: AL0SL

fields.description: Extended Tag Field Supported: Set when device allows the tag field to be extended from 5 to 8 bits. This field reflects the setting of the corresponding field in the PCIe Device Capability Register of PF 0.
fields.name: ETFS

fields.description: Phantom Functions Supported: This field is used to extend the tag field by combining unused Function bits with the tag bits. This field is hardwired to 00 to disable this feature.
fields.name: PFS

fields.description: Max Payload Size: Specifies maximum payload size supported by the device. This field reflects the setting of the corresponding field in the PCIe Device Capability Register of PF 0
fields.name: MPS

fields.description: Reserved: Reserved
fields.name: R4

fields.description: Transaction Pending: Indicates if any of the Non-Posted requests issued by the VF are still pending.
fields.name: TP

fields.description: Aux Power Detected: Reserved
fields.name: APD

fields.description: Unsupported Request Detected: Set to 1 by the core when it receives an unsupported request, regardless of  whether its reporting is enabled or not.
fields.name: URD

fields.description: Fatal Error Detected: Set to 1 by the core when it detects a fatal error, regardless of whether error  reporting is enabled or not, and regardless of whether the error is masked.
fields.name: FED

fields.description: Non-Fatal Error Detected: Set to 1 by the core when it detects a non-fatal error, regardless of whether  error reporting is enabled or not, and regardless of whether the error is masked.
fields.name: NFER

fields.description: Correctable Error Detected: Set to 1 by the core when it detects a correctable error, regardless of whether  error reporting is enabled or not, and regardless of whether the error is masked
fields.name: CED

fields.description: Function-Level Reset: Writing a 1 into this bit position generated a Function-Level Reset for the selected VF. This bit reads as 0.
fields.name: FLR

fields.description: Max Read Request Size: Reserved
fields.name: MRRS

fields.description: Enable No Snoop: Reserved
fields.name: EBS

fields.description: Enable Aux Power: Reserved
fields.name: EAP

fields.description: Enable Phantom Functions: Reserved
fields.name: EPF

fields.description: Extended Tag Field Enable: Reserved
fields.name: ETFE

fields.description: Max Payload Size: Reserved
fields.name: MPS

fields.description: Enable Relaxed Ordering: Reserved
fields.name: ERO

fields.description: Enable Unsupported Request Reporting: Reserved
fields.name: EURR

fields.description: Enable Fatal Error Reporting: Reserved
fields.name: EFER

fields.description: Enable Non-Fatal Error Reporting: Reserved
fields.name: ENFER

fields.description: Enable Correctable Error Reporting: Reserved
fields.name: ECER

fields.description: PME Support for D3(cold) State: Indicates whether the Function is capable of sending PME messages when in the D3cold state. Because the device does not have aux power, this bit is hardwired to 0.
fields.name: PSDCS

fields.description: PME Support for D3(hot) State: Indicates whether the Function is capable of sending PME messages when in the D3hot state. This bit is set to 1 by default, but can be modified from the local management bus by writing into Function 0. All other Functions assume the value set in Function 0s Power Management Capabilities Register.
fields.name: PSDHS

fields.description: PME Support for D2 State: Indicates whether the Function is capable of sending PME messages when in the D2 state. This bit is hardwired to 0 because D2 state is not supported.
fields.name: PSD2S

fields.description: PME Support for D1 State: Indicates whether the Function is capable of sending PME messages when in the D1 state. This bit is set to 1 by default, but can be modified from the local management bus by writing into Function 0. All other Functions assume the value set in Function 0s Power Management Capabilities Register.
fields.name: PSD1S

fields.description: PME Support for D0 State: Indicates whether the Function is capable of sending PME messages when in the D0 state. This bit is set to 1 by default, but can be modified from the local management bus by writing into Function 0. All other Functions assume the value set in Function 0s Power Management Capabilities Register.
fields.name: PSD0S

fields.description: D2 Support: Set if the Function supports the D2 power state. Currently hardwired to 0.
fields.name: D2S

fields.description: D1 Support: Set if the Function supports the D1 power state. This bit  can be modified from the local management bus by writing into Function 0. All other Functions assume the value set in Function 0s Power Management Capabilities Register.
fields.name: D1S

fields.description: Max Current Required from Aux Power Supply: Specifies the maximum current drawn by the device from the aux power source in the D3cold state. This field is not implemented in devices not supporting PME notification when in the D3cold state, and is therefore hardwired to 0.
fields.name: MCRAPS

fields.description: Device Specific Initialization Bit: This bit, when set, indicates that the device requires additional configuration steps beyond setting up its PCI configuration space, to bring it to the D0active state from the D0uninitialized state. This bit is hardwired to 0.
fields.name: DSI

fields.description: Reserved: Reserved
fields.name: R0

fields.description: PME Clock: Not applicable to PCI Express. This bit is hardwired to 0.
fields.name: PC

fields.description: Version ID: Indicates the version of the PCI Bus Power Management Specifications that the Function implements. This field is set by default to 011 (Version 1.2). It can be re-written independently for each Function from the local management bus.
fields.name: VID

fields.description: Capabilities Pointer: Contains pointer to the next PCI Capability Structure. The core sets it to the value defined in the RTL file reg_defaults.h. By default, this points to the MSI Capability Structure. This field can be re-written independently for each Function from the local management bus.
fields.name: CP

fields.description: Capability ID: Identifies that the capability structure is for Power Management. This field is set by default to 01 hex. It can be re-written independently for each Function from the local management bus.
fields.name: CID

fields.description: Data Register: This optional register is not implemented in the Cadence PCIe core. This field is hardwired to 0.
fields.name: DR

fields.description: Reserved: Reserved
fields.name: R1

fields.description: PME Status: When PME notification is enabled, writing a 1 into this bit position from the local management bus sets this bit and causes the core to send a PME message from the associated Function. When the Root Complex processes this message, it will turn off this bit by writing a 1 into this bit position though a Config Write. This bit can be set or cleared from the local management bus, by writing a 1 or 0, respectively. It can only be cleared from the configuration path (by writing a 1).
fields.name: PMES

fields.description: Reserved: Reserved
fields.name: R2

fields.description: PME Enable: Setting this bit enables the notification of PME events from the associated Function. This bit can be set also by writing into this register from the local management bus.
fields.name: PE

fields.description: Reserved: Reserved
fields.name: R3

fields.description: No Soft Reset: When this bit is set to 1, the Function will maintain all its state in the PM state D3hot. The software is not required to re-initialize the Function registers on the transition back to D0. This bit is set to 1 by default, but can be modified independently for each VF from the local management bus.
fields.name: NSR

fields.description: Reserved: Reserved
fields.name: R4

fields.description: Power State: Indicates the power state this Function is currently in. This field can be read by the software to monitor the current power state, or can be written to cause a transition to a new state. The valid settings are 00 (state D0), 01 (state D1) and 11 (state D3hot). The software should not write any other value into this field. This field can also be written from the local management bus independently for each VF Function.
fields.name: PS

fields.description: Class Code: Identifies the function of the device. This field reflects the setting of the corresponding register in the configuration space of the associated Physical Function.
fields.name: CC

fields.description: Sub-Class Code: Identifies a sub-category within the selected function. This field reflects the setting of the corresponding register in the configuration space of the associated Physical Function.
fields.name: SCC

fields.description: Programming Interface Byte: Identifies the register set layout of the device. This field reflects the setting of the corresponding register in the configuration space of the associated Physical Function.
fields.name: PIB

fields.description: Revision ID: Assigned by the manufacturer of the device to identify the revision RO Setting of this field Denali Cadence-PCIe Core User Guide, PMC-Sierra Version 3.4 202 number of the device. This field reflects the setting of the corresponding register in the configuration space of the associated Physical Function.
fields.name: RID

fields.description: Subsystem ID: Specifies the Subsystem ID assigned by the manufacturer of the device. This field reflects the setting of the corresponding register in the configuration space of the associated Physical Function.
fields.name: SID

fields.description: Subsystem Vendor ID: Specifies the Subsystem Vendor ID assigned by the PCI SIG to the manufacturer of the device.This field when read reflects the Subsystem Vendor ID of the Physical Function the VF is associated with.
fields.name: SVID

fields.description: Reserved:
fields.name: R4

fields.description: Reserved:
fields.name: R8

fields.description: Reserved: Reserved
fields.name: R3

fields.description: Uncorrectable Internal Error Status: This bit is not implemented for Virtual Functions. Hardwired to 0.
fields.name: Uncorr_Int_Err_Status

fields.description: Reserved: Reserved
fields.name: R2

fields.description: Unsupported Request Error Status: This bit is set when the core has received a request from the link that it does not support. This error is not Function-specific. This error is considered non-fatal by default. In the special case described in Sections 6.2.3.2.4.1 of the PCI Express Specifications, the error is reported by sending an ERR_COR message. In all other cases, the error is reported by sending an ERR_NONFATAL message. The header of the received request that caused the error is logged in the Header Log Registers. STICKY.
fields.name: URES

fields.description: ECRC Error Status: This bit is not implemented for Virtual Functions. Hardwired to 0.
fields.name: ECRC_Err_Status

fields.description: Malformed TLP Status: This bit is not implemented for Virtual Functions. Hardwired to 0.
fields.name: Malformed_TLP_Status

fields.description: Receiver Overflow Status: This bit is not implemented for Virtual Functions. Hardwired to 0.
fields.name: Rcvr_Overflow_Status

fields.description: Unexpected Completion Status: This bit is set when the core has received an unexpected Completion packet from the link. This error is not Function-specific. STICKY.
fields.name: UCS

fields.description: Completer Abort Status: This bit is set when the core has returned the Completer Abort (CA) status to a request received from the link. This error is Function-specific. The header of the received request that caused the error is logged in the Header Log Registers. STICKY.
fields.name: CAS

fields.description: Completion Timeout Status: This bit is set when the completion timer associated with an outstanding request times out. This error is Function-specific. This error is considered non-fatal by default. STICKY.
fields.name: CTS

fields.description: Flow Control Protocol Error Status: This bit is is not implemented for Virtual Functions. Hardwired to 0.
fields.name: FCPES

fields.description: Poisoned TLP Status: This bit is set when the core receives a poisoned TLP from the link, targeted at this VF. This error is Function-specific. This error is considered non-fatal by default. The error is reported by sending an ERR_NONFATAL message. The header of the received TLP with error is logged in the Header Log Registers associated with the VF. STICKY.
fields.name: PTS

fields.description: Reserved: Reserved
fields.name: R1

fields.description: Data Link Protocol Error Status: This bit is not implemented for Virtual Functions. Hardwired to 0.
fields.name: DLPER

fields.description: Reserved: Reserved
fields.name: R0

fields.description: Device ID: Device ID assigned by the manufacturer of the device. On power-up, the core sets it to the value defined in the RTL file reg_defaults.h. This field can be written independently for each Function from the local management bus.
fields.name: DID

fields.description: Vendor ID: A read to this register returns FFFFh for VFs
fields.name: VID
